Sentencas: Bl(2)O(3) doped with Y2O3 in the cubic-8 structure is a promising electrolyte material to bring the operating temperatures of solid oxide fuel cells (SOFCs) down to <= 650 degrees C.
Titulo: Impact of fabrication temperature on the stability of yttria doped bismuth oxide ceramics

Sentencas: However, even in the doped state, the stability of its fast-ionic conductor phase (cubic-8) at this targeted operating temperature is questionable.
Titulo: Impact of fabrication temperature on the stability of yttria doped bismuth oxide ceramics

Sentencas: In this work, the stability of the electrical conductivity of 28 mol% Y2O3 doped Bi2O3 (YDB) ceramics sintered at different temperatures was investigated.
Titulo: Impact of fabrication temperature on the stability of yttria doped bismuth oxide ceramics

Sentencas: YDB ceramics sintered at 800 degrees C exhibited a fast, exponential-type conductivity decay with a concomitant cubic to rhombohedral phase transformation upon a 100-hour exposure to 650 degrees C, in stagnant air.
Titulo: Impact of fabrication temperature on the stability of yttria doped bismuth oxide ceramics

Sentencas: On the other hand, all the YDB ceramics sintered at higher temperatures (900-1100 degrees C) experienced a slower, linear conductivity decay under the same conditions, but with no observable phase transformation.
Titulo: Impact of fabrication temperature on the stability of yttria doped bismuth oxide ceramics

Sentencas: This difference was explained in the premise that, based on the most recent Y2O3-Bi2O3 phase diagram, YDB sintered at 800 degrees C had a higher amount of metastable cubic-8 phase than those sintered at higher temperatures.
Titulo: Impact of fabrication temperature on the stability of yttria doped bismuth oxide ceramics

Sentencas: Practically, it was suggested that for SOFC applications, the conventional approach of lowering the sintering temperature to reduce the manufacturing costs would result in poor stability in YDB electrolytes.
Titulo: Impact of fabrication temperature on the stability of yttria doped bismuth oxide ceramics
